articles.title: Functions Held in Democratic Congo
March Issue of Newspaper "The Juche Idea" Published
articles.content:
Functions Held in Democratic Congo 
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A special lecture was given at University in Kinshasa of Democratic Congo on Mar. 1 and a seminar was held at a vocational training school in the same country on Mar. 6 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 74th anniversary of the founding of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 Bele Mukeleng, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of University of Kinshasa, gave a lecture titled "On the ideological and theoretical basis of the Songun idea" in which he explained in detail the glorious revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung and the undying exploits of Kim Jong Il who has trained the KPA into an invincible army and the main force of the Songun revolution and brought about the greatest success in the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation.
 It is thanks to the Songun idea that the Juche idea is displaying ever greater might, he noted, adding that the Songun idea serves as great guidelines in the present times.
 Nzemba Yangana, chairman of the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo, noted in his speech titled "The Juche idea is an immortal idea having ever-lasting vitality" that the Juche idea is an idea which calls for solving all problems arising in the revolution and construction by oneself in conformity with the actual conditions of one's country and a genuine patriotic idea that requires firmly defending independence of the country and the nation.    
 The Juche idea serves as an ever-lasting guiding idea for mankind as it powerfully encourages the progressive people in their struggle to carve out their destiny and transform the world, he stressed.

articles.title: Halt to Negotiations for Conclusion of FTA Demanded in S. Korea
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Havana
articles.content:
Halt to Negotiations for Conclusion of FTA Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Should the south Korean authorities sign FTA with the U.S., the production of medicines, etc. in south Korea will be restricted by the pharmaceutical companies of the U.S., which will immediately lead to skyrocketing prices of medicines.
 Twelve health organizations including the Pharmacists Association for a Healthy Society said this at a news conference held on Mar. 9 in Seoul demanding an immediate halt to the negotiations for the conclusion of FTA.    
 They warned that the signing of FTA would lead to the commercialization of the health system to widen the gap between the rich and the poor and aggravate social antagonism, the south Korean KBS said.

articles.title: Anniversary of Arboretum of KMP Observed
articles.content:
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Havana 
    Havana, March 12 (KCNA) -- A reception was given at the DPRK embassy in Havana on Mar. 10 to mark the 20th anniversary of the DPRK visit by Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Cuba.
 Present there on invitation were officials of the party, state and army including Fernando Ramirez, head of the International Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of Cuba, and Raul Valdes Vivo, director of the Cuban higher party school who are members of the Party Central Committee, Marcos Rodriguez, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Pedro Mendiond Gomez, commander of the Air and Anti-Aircraft Defense Forces of the Revolutionary Armed Forces, Buenaventura Reyes, vice-president of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples, and Juan Jose Leon Vega, chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification.    
 On hand were DPRK Ambassador Pak Tong Chun and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Havana.

articles.title: Suppression under NSL Denounced
U.S. Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign under Fire
articles.content:
Suppression under NSL Denounced 
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Joint Measure Committee for the Abolition of the National Security Law, Defence of Academic Freedom and Opposition to Persecution of Prof. Kang Jong Gu involving 130 civic and social organizations of south Korea called a news conference in front of the building of the Seoul Central District Court on Mar. 10.
 Recalling that Kang Jong Gu, professor of Dongguk University, was brought to trial on the charge of violation of the �gNational Security Law�h for the mere reason that he had made public in a peaceful manner the results of his researches as dictated by his conscience as a scholar, the committee said this ran counter to the international convention on human rights and the basic principles of democracy.
 It demanded the judicial authorities immediately stop the trial. 
 The press release made public at the end of the news conference noted that south Korea was now shamefully stigmatized as a backward society in human rights and society of human rights abuses internationally owing to the conservative forces and demanded the authorities abolish the NSL, ensure academic freedom and stop the persecution of the professor.

articles.title: U.S. Warhawks' Anti-DPRK Malarkey under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign under Fire 
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. State Department in an "annual report on human rights" on March 8 malignantly slandered the DPRK as a country with poorest human rights record as it shows no improvement. Earlier Bush, Rice and other high-ranking politicians of the U.S. administration raised a hue and cry over the human rights situation in the DPRK.
 In this regard, a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry in a statement on March 13 said that the U.S. has no right to say about someone's human rights as it is the worst human rights abuser and the biggest tundra of human rights.
 Noting that the American society is a typical unpopular society where even elementary right of the people to existence is wantonly abused, the statement continued:
 The human rights situation in the U.S. has gone from bad to worse since Bush came to power.    
 The Bush group illegally occupied Iraq defying the UN, international law and the world public opinion to mercilessly massacre innocent civilians and turn Iraq into a sea of blood caused by a civil war.    
 After attacking Iraq under the pretext of preventing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction (WMD)" the U.S. used not only WMD including depleted uranium shells but white phosphorus shells belonging to chemical weapons.
 The Bush administration issued a formal instruction for changing the interpretation of the Geneva Convention which strictly restricts the interrogation methods and approving more strict interrogation methods. It openly committed such horrendous atrocities as torturing undressed prisoners in Iraq, Afghanistan and Guantanamo.
 The CIA set up and operated even secret prisons in Europe and different countries to harshly maltreat and punish prisoners after working out rules for its overseas prisons with the permission of the administration.    
 This being a hard reality, the U.S. claims to be a "protector of human rights", raising a hue and cry over the human rights. This is a grave insult to the fair world public opinion. 
 The U.S. loudmouthed "human rights" is a blatant interference in the internal affairs of the DPRK by the Bush administration, which, prompted by inveterate bitterness toward it, seeks to achieve a sinister political purpose to isolate and stifle it.
 The escalated human rights offensive of the U.S. and hostile forces against the DPRK would only compel it to take every possible measure to defend sovereignty under the uplifted banner of Songun, firmly convinced of truth that human rights precisely mean sovereignty.

articles.title: Day of Buddha's Nirvana Observed
Spring Tree-Planting at Full Swing
articles.content:
Day of Buddha's Nirvana Observed
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Masses took place at different temples of the DPRK on March 14 to mark the Day of Buddha's Nirvana in 2550 B. E. (Buddhist Era). 
 They were attended by office bearers of the Central Committee of the Korean Buddhist Federation and its provincial, city and county committees, priests and chief priests of relevant temples and Buddhists.  A ritual for the occasion was followed by sermons and speeches.    
 The speakers said they were holding masses to mark the Day of Buddha's Nirvana at a time when all the people of the country are out as one in the dynamic drive for achieving national reunification and building a great prosperous powerful nation. They called upon all the Buddhists in the north and the south and overseas to unite in the Nirvana-minded concord to take the lead in the patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself" this year in order to build a rich and powerful reunified nation.

articles.title: Powerful Assistance to Countryside
KCNA Discloses True Colors of Japan's Distortion of History
Reception Given by Secretary of Libyan People's Bureau
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Reception Given by Secretary of Libyan People's Bureau
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the People's Bureau of Libya to the DPRK, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Mar. 13 on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of the proclamation of Jamahiriya.
 Present there on invitation were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned.    
 Speeches were made there.

SPA Chairman Meets British Ambassador
KPA Panmunjom Mission Hits U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises
articles.content:
SPA Chairman Meets British Ambassador
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met with John Everard, British ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.
 Present at the meeting was Ri Jong Hyok, deputy to the SPA and chairman of the DPRK-British friendship parliamentary group.

articles.title: Visits
UN Executive Director Leaves
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Jean Jacques Graisse, senior deputy executive director of the World Food Programme, and a delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Singapore led by Bilahari Kausikan, its second permanent secretary, arrived here by air Tuesday.
